00002 // ResCache.cpp : Defines a simple resource cache

00049 ResourceZipFile::~ResourceZipFile() 
00050 { 
00051         SAFE_DELETE(m_pZipFile); 
00052 }
00053 
00054 bool ResourceZipFile::VOpen()
00055 {
00056         m_pZipFile = GCC_NEW CZipFile;
00057     if (m_pZipFile)
00058     {
00059                 return m_pZipFile->Init(m_resFileName.c_str());
00060         }
00061         return false;   
00062 }
00063 
00064 int ResourceZipFile::VGetResourceSize(const Resource &r)
00065 {
00066         int size = 0;
00067         optional<int> resourceNum = m_pZipFile->Find(r.m_name.c_str());
00068         if (resourceNum.valid())
00069         {
00070                 size = m_pZipFile->GetFileLen(*resourceNum);
00071         }
00072         return size;    
00073 }
00074 
00075 int ResourceZipFile::VGetResource(const Resource &r, char *buffer)
00076 {
00077         int size = 0;
00078         optional<int> resourceNum = m_pZipFile->Find(r.m_name.c_str());
00079         if (resourceNum.valid())
00080         {
00081                 size = m_pZipFile->GetFileLen(*resourceNum);
00082                 m_pZipFile->ReadFile(*resourceNum, buffer);
00083         }
00084         return 0;       
00085 }

00088 
00089 ResHandle::ResHandle(const Resource & resource, const char *buffer)
00090 : m_resource(resource)
00091 {
00092         m_buffer = buffer;
00093 }
00094 
00095 ResHandle::~ResHandle()
00096 {
00097         if (m_buffer) delete [] m_buffer;
00098 }
00099 
00100 ResCache::ResCache(const unsigned int sizeInMb, IResourceFile *resFile )
00101 {
00102         m_cacheSize = sizeInMb * 1024 * 1024;                           // total memory size
00103         m_allocated = 0;                                                                        // total memory allocated
00104         m_file = resFile;
00105 }
00106 
00107 ResCache::~ResCache()
00108 {
00109         while (!m_lru.empty())
00110         {
00111                 FreeOneResource();
00112         }
00113         SAFE_DELETE(m_file);
00114 }
00115 
00116 
00117 bool ResCache::Create(Resource &r)
00118 {
00119         r.m_size = m_file->VGetResourceSize(r);
00120         return (r.m_size>0);
00121 }
00122 
00123 
00124 const void *ResCache::Get(const Resource & r )
00125 {
00126         ResHandle *handle = Find(r);
00127         return (handle!=NULL) ? Update(handle) : Load(r);
00128 }
00129 
00130 
00131 const void * ResCache::Load(const Resource & r)
00132 {
00133         // Note: Change Post-printing
00134         //
00135         // Graphic resources are loaded differently, since the tool that created them (Ipac)
00136         // added some data to grab any sequence of frames - not just the whole thing.
00137         // 
00138         // Added an optional<int> &len in case we wanted to return the
00139         // length of the resource in bytes.
00140 
00141         int size = m_file->VGetResourceSize(r);
00142         char *buffer = Allocate(size);
00143         if (buffer==NULL)
00144         {
00145                 return NULL;            // ResCache is out of memory!
00146         }
00147 
00148         // Create a new resource and add it to the lru list and map
00149         ResHandle *handle = GCC_NEW ResHandle(r, buffer);
00150         m_lru.push_front(handle);
00151         m_resources[r.m_name] = handle;
00152 
00153         m_file->VGetResource(r, buffer);
00154 
00155         return buffer;
00156 }
00157 
00158 
00159 ResHandle *ResCache::Find(const Resource & r)
00160 {
00161         ResHandleMap::iterator i = m_resources.find(r.m_name);
00162         if (i==m_resources.end())
00163                 return NULL;
00164 
00165         return (*i).second;
00166 }
00167 
00168 const void *ResCache::Update(ResHandle *handle)
00169 {
00170         m_lru.remove(handle);
00171         m_lru.push_front(handle);
00172 
00173         return handle->m_buffer;
00174 }
00175 
00176 
00177 
00178 
00179 char *ResCache::Allocate(unsigned int size)
00180 {
00181         if (!MakeRoom(size))
00182                 return NULL;
00183 
00184         char *mem = GCC_NEW char[size];
00185         if (mem)
00186         {
00187                 m_allocated += size;
00188         }
00189 
00190         return mem;
00191 }
00192 
00193 
00194 void ResCache::FreeOneResource()
00195 {
00196         ResHandleList::iterator gonner = m_lru.end();
00197         gonner--;
00198 
00199         ResHandle *handle = *gonner;
00200 
00201         m_lru.pop_back();                                                       
00202         m_resources.erase(handle->m_resource.m_name);
00203         m_allocated -= handle->m_resource.m_size ;
00204         delete handle;
00205 }
00206 
00207 
00208 
00209 
00210 void ResCache::Flush()
00211 {
00212         while (!m_lru.empty())
00213         {
00214                 ResHandle *handle = *(m_lru.begin());
00215                 Free(handle);
00216                 m_lru.pop_front();
00217         }
00218 }
00219 
00220 
00221 
00222 bool ResCache::MakeRoom(unsigned int size)
00223 {
00224         if (size > m_cacheSize)
00225         {
00226                 return false;
00227         }
00228 
00229         // return null if there's no possible way to allocate the memory
00230         while (size > (m_cacheSize - m_allocated))
00231         {
00232                 // The cache is empty, and there's still not enough room.
00233                 if (m_lru.empty())
00234                         return false;
00235 
00236                 FreeOneResource();
00237         }
00238 
00239         return true;
00240 }
00241 
00242 
00243 
00244 void ResCache::Free(ResHandle *gonner)
00245 {
00246         m_lru.remove(gonner);
00247         m_resources.erase(gonner->m_resource.m_name);
00248         m_allocated -= gonner->m_resource.m_size;
00249         delete gonner;
00250 }
